title: Readiness to train scale
text:
Thank you again for agreeing to participate in our readiness to train scale validation study




As a reminder, this study involves completing a brief 6-question survey about how you feel before exercise, after the warm-up, and on completion of your exercise session.


How much time will this take?
The survey will take approximately 1 minute to complete each time


When do I need to complete this survey?
We ask that you complete this survey at three time points:


Immediately prior to commencing your exercise session (Pre-session – Survey #1);




After your warm-up but before your exercise session (Post-warm-up – Survey #2); and




Within thirty minutes of completing your exercise session (Post-session – Survey #3)




How often do I need to complete this survey?
We ask that you repeat this process every time you come to the gym over the next four consecutive exercise sessions.


Why should I participate?
Your participation will help us design a tool for exercise physiologists and physiotherapists to support people living with and beyond cancer exercise optimally during their good and bad days.


Will my answers remain confidential?
Your answers will be de-identified and will remain confidential within the research team.


Is participation voluntary?
Thank you for your prior written consent to participate in this research project. If you change your mind, you are free to withdraw at any time by contacting the Chief Investigator, Dr Grace Rose [grose1@usc.edu.au].


Your participation is completely voluntary. By completing the surveys (forms linked below) you are consenting to your data being used for the research purposes described above.


What if I have questions?
If you have any questions, please speak to your exercise physiologist, or contact the Project Coordinator, Brent Cunningham [Contact]. If you have any technical questions or would like to make it easier to access the survey each time, please go to the Website FAQ tab.


What should I do now?


Please click on the relevant link below to complete the survey three times during your current exercise session

 
  
    Number 1 - Pre-session 
  
  
    Number 2 - Post-warm up 
  
  
    Number 3 - Post-session

title: FAQ
text:
A quick reminder of the process

Over your next four exercise sessions you will complete each of surveys three times during your exercise session.



Pre-session – prior to starting exercise




Post warm-up – following your warm-up or after 5 minutes of movement




Post session – complete within 30 minutes of completing your exercise session



When you click on the link to a survey, it will open a new tab. When you’ve submitted your survey responses you can close the tab.
Each time you wish to complete the next survey, simply open the webpage again and click the link for the next survey.
I suggest adding the webpage to your home screen for convenience as you can simply click this each time you attend your exercise session or each time you need to complete the survey.

Create Website Shortcut
The home screen on your smartphone or tablet isn’t just a place where your apps live. You can also add shortcuts to websites. Here’s how to create an “app” for any website on your device, allowing you to access shortcuts directly from your home screen.
iPhone or iPad

Open Safari. Other browsers, such as Chrome, won’t work for this.
Navigate to the website you want to save to your home screen by entering the URL of the website you want to create a shortcut to. Make sure you visit the exact page you want to open through the shortcut. Tap “Go.”
Tap the Share button on the bottom of the page. It looks like a square with an arrow pointing out of the top.
In the list of options that appear, scroll down until you see Add to Home Screen. Tap this. The Add to Home Screen dialog box will appear.
Choose a name for the website shortcut on your home screen. You’ll see the link so you can confirm it, as well as the site’s favicon that will appear as the “app” icon on your home screen. Click Add when you’re done. Safari will close automatically, and you will be taken to where the icon is located on your iPhone’s or iPad’s home screen.
Now just tap the new “app” or shortcut on your home screen, and it will open the website in its own navigation window, independent of what you have open in Safari.
Note: If you ever decide you want to remove the website shortcut, you can delete it just like you would any other app on your phone.

Android

Open Chrome.
Navigate to the website or web page you want to pin to your home screen.
Tap the menu icon (3 dots in upper right-hand corner) and tap Add to home screen.
Choose a name for the website shortcut, then Chrome will add it to your home screen.
